Description: Fragment of limestone tomb-relief with a fine quality carving of the left hand of a figure, holding a staff (?). The hand is painted red and the staff a slightly paler shade of red. Broken on all edges with some of the surface lost.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Lisht, el-, Probably from Lisht South. Previously recorded on Merlin as being from 'Thebes'. It is unclear what this was based on.
